publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-306 Tommy Sheridan: National Air Traffic Services—That the Parliament believes that air safety in Scotland is best served through the retention of the national air traffic services in the public sector; rejects Her Majesty's Government’s plans to privatise national air traffic services, and supports the campaign of the relevant trade unions on behalf of the public and in the interests of air safety throughout Scotland to keep air traffic control in the public sector where it belongs.

S1M-306 Tommy Sheridan: National Air Traffic Services—That the Parliament believes that air safety in Scotland is best served through the retention of the national air traffic services in the public sector; rejects Her Majesty's Government’s plans to privatise national air traffic services, and supports the campaign of the relevant trade unions on behalf of the public and in the interests of air safety throughout Scotland to keep air traffic control in the public sector where it belongs. Supported by: Michael Matheson*
S1M-306 National Air Traffic Services (lodged on 18 November 1999) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Andrew Wilson*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S1M-306 National Air Traffic Services (lodged on 18 November 1999) Linda Fabiani*

S1M-306 Tommy Sheridan: National Air Traffic Services—That the Parliament believes that air safety in Scotland is best served through the retention of the national air traffic services in the public sector; rejects Her Majesty's Government’s plans to privatise national air traffic services, and supports the campaign of the relevant trade unions on behalf of the public and in the interests of air safety throughout Scotland to keep air traffic control in the public sector where it belongs. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Andrew Wilson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Linda Fabiani
S1M-306 National Air Traffic Services (lodged on 18 November 1999) Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-306 National Air Traffic Services (lodged on 18 November 1999) Robin Harper*, Kay Ullrich*
S1M-306 National Air Traffic Services (lodged on 18 November 1999) Mr Jamie McGrigor*

S1M-306 Tommy Sheridan: National Air Traffic Services—That the Parliament believes that air safety in Scotland is best served through the retention of the national air traffic services in the public sector; rejects Her Majesty's Government’s plans to privatise national air traffic services, and supports the campaign of the relevant trade unions on behalf of the public and in the interests of air safety throughout Scotland to keep air traffic control in the public sector where it belongs. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Andrew Wilson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Linda Fabiani, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Robin Harper, Kay Ullrich, Mr Jamie McGrigor
S1M-306 National Air Traffic Services (lodged on 18 November 1999) Christine Grahame*

S1M-306 Tommy Sheridan: National Air Traffic Services—That the Parliament believes that air safety in Scotland is best served through the retention of the national air traffic services in the public sector; rejects Her Majesty's Government’s plans to privatise national air traffic services, and supports the campaign of the relevant trade unions on behalf of the public and in the interests of air safety throughout Scotland to keep air traffic control in the public sector where it belongs. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Andrew Wilson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Linda Fabiani, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Robin Harper, Kay Ullrich, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Christine Grahame
S1M-306 National Air Traffic Services (lodged on 18 November 1999) Shona Robison*
S1M-306 National Air Traffic Services (lodged on 18 November 1999) Alex Neil*

S1M-306 Tommy Sheridan: National Air Traffic Services—That the Parliament believes that air safety in Scotland is best served through the retention of the national air traffic services in the public sector; rejects Her Majesty's Government’s plans to privatise national air traffic services, and supports the campaign of the relevant trade unions on behalf of the public and in the interests of air safety throughout Scotland to keep air traffic control in the public sector where it belongs. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Andrew Wilson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Linda Fabiani, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Robin Harper, Kay Ullrich, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Christine Grahame, Shona Robison, Alex Neil
S1M-306 National Air Traffic Services (lodged on 18 November 1999) Ms Margo MacDonald*

S1M-306 Tommy Sheridan: National Air Traffic Services—That the Parliament believes that air safety in Scotland is best served through the retention of the national air traffic services in the public sector; rejects Her Majesty's Government’s plans to privatise national air traffic services, and supports the campaign of the relevant trade unions on behalf of the public and in the interests of air safety throughout Scotland to keep air traffic control in the public sector where it belongs. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Andrew Wilson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Linda Fabiani, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Robin Harper, Kay Ullrich, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Christine Grahame, Shona Robison, Alex Neil, Ms Margo MacDonald

S1M-306 Tommy Sheridan: National Air Traffic Services—That the Parliament believes that air safety in Scotland is best served through the retention of the national air traffic services in the public sector; rejects Her Majesty's Government’s plans to privatise national air traffic services, and supports the campaign of the relevant trade unions on behalf of the public and in the interests of air safety throughout Scotland to keep air traffic control in the public sector where it belongs. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Andrew Wilson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Linda Fabiani, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Robin Harper, Kay Ullrich, Christine Grahame, Shona Robison, Alex Neil, Ms Margo MacDonald, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Michael Russell
